channel.title: Search on Hashnopolis
channel.description: Recent content in Search on Hashnopolis

item.title: Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array
item.description: Given an array of integers nums sorted in ascending order, find the starting and ending position of a given target value. Your algorithm’s runtime complexity must be in the order of O(log n). If the target is not found in the array, return [-1, -1]. Example 1: Input: nums = [5,7,7,8,8,10], target = 8 Output: [3,4] Example 2: Input: nums = [5,7,7,8,8,10], target = 6 Output: [-1,-1] Solution:

item.title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
item.description: Suppose an array sorted in ascending order is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand. (i.e., [0,1,2,4,5,6,7] might become [4,5,6,7,0,1,2]). You are given a target value to search. If found in the array return its index, otherwise return -1. You may assume no duplicate exists in the array. Your algorithm’s runtime complexity must be in the order of O(log n). Example 1: Input: nums = [4,5,6,7,0,1,2], target = 0 Output: 4 Example 2:
